title: CCP Announces the Candidates for CSM19 as the Election Campaign Begins
description: The application period to run for the 19th EVE Online Council of Stellar Management closed a week back and on Friday CCP announced the candidates who would be on the ballot for the election. The campaign period is now in full swing, with CCP having done quick interviews on Twitch with candidates.  The campaign period […]
author: Wilhelm Arcturus
excerpt: The application period to run for the 19th EVE Online Council of Stellar Management closed a week back and on Friday CCP announced the candidates who would be on the ballot for the election. The ca…
text: The application period to run for the 19th EVE Online Council of Stellar Management closed a week back and on Friday CCP announced the candidates who would be on the ballot for the election. Council of Stellar Management 19 The campaign period is now in full swing, with CCP having done quick interviews on Twitch with candidates.  The campaign period will run until voting commences on October 17th. 4-14 October: CSM 19 Campaign Period 17-24 October: CSM 19 Voting Period I don’t know what CCP thinks candidates are supposed to do on the 15th and 16th… I mean, I just copied and pasted their dates… but I suspect it will be more campaigning. This time around there are 49 candidates running for the 10 seats on the council… with those who place between 11th and 20th in the ballots being possible picks for the remaining two seats that CCP chooses to balance out the group. 49 just happens to be the same number of candidates who were in for the CSM18 election.  So… continuity I guess. I have taken CCP’s post about the candidates and put it in a table and added the link to the candidate’s forum post describing their plan for the CSM.  I have also marked incumbents with a single asterisk and those who have served on the CSM before with a double asterisk. Candidate Alliance Corp Aerodinamica Attiva None Reckless and Uncontrolable Feeding Alcoholic Satan* Pandemic Horde A Blessed Bean Ankh Lai Goonswarm Federation Strategically Bad Aqustin Agustus Brave Collective Spoopy Newbies Ariel Rin The Initiative. Tactically Challenged AtheistOfFail None Totality Squad Aurous Victoirespere Space Madness. Phantom Space Bexey Songweaver Aurora Alliance Phantom Regiment Colby Bosh’tet Feasting Frenzy Great White Hunters commander Shepard Brotherhood Goonswarm Federation Mindstar Technology creatnos NullSechnaya Sholupen You’re dunked Dalros Absolute Will Absolute Order VI Drake Iddon Rote Kapelle CastleKickers Dujek Oneye Brave Collective Brave Newbies Inc. DutchGunner Wicked Angels. Circle of Abyss Frippyy Goonswarm Federation KarmaFleet Frozen Fallout Federation Front Line Federation Front Line Report Gideon Zendikar D-sync. D-sync Grima The Mad Recursive Horizons Ouroboros Solutions Gustav Mannfred Remember Mumuit Summer of Mumuit Hexator Gaming No Therapy Loot ‘n’ Scoot Salvage Co. Itaer IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII Neurotoxin Control Kazanir* Goonswarm Federation GoonWaffe Kenneth Feld** Pandemic Legion Habitual Euthanasia Komo Sunder The Initiative. Applied Anarchy Kshal Aideron* The Ancients. F.U.N. Inc. Luke Anninan* Fraternity. Into Oblivion. Machagon None Amamake Anarchist Community College Mcopiate Brave Collective Asylum Misfits Mick Fightmaster No Vacancies. No Vacancies Mike Azariah* None The Scope MILINT ARC Trooper None Pator Tech School NeoShocker Scary Wormhole People The Dark Space Initiative Phantomite** Watch This Blue Canary Prospektor Schipplock EDENCOM DEFENSIVE INITIATIVE EDENCOM Section 7 Redus Taw Pandemic Horde Farmers Union Iced Coffee Rots Mijnwerker Out of the Blue. Into the Ether Seddow Deepwater Hooligans Outback Steakhouse of Pancakes SeriesPro UNITED SOUTH Don’t Be a Menace to South Central SKALE Organa TURBOFEED OR GLORY Holey Roamin’ Empire steven mardis Sugar. Wormhole Effects Storm Delay* Pandemic Horde Horde Vanguard. Styxx D.A.R.K. Dark Shado Switch 4 Divine Damnation Heretic Army The Oz* None Pecunia Infinita Viciate Minmatar Fleet Alliance Rattini Tribe Yondu Quill Brave Collective Brave Newbies Inc. youngpuke2 Sedition. Jerkasaurus Wrecks Inc. Zintage Enaka Goonswarm Federation Echelon Research 49 candidates is a lot of people and, more than 18 years into the game, I could probably string together three sentences about maybe five of them… and at least two of those would need to go negative. On the flip side, I can only confirm one candidate knows who I am… or at least pretends to… which is Mike Azariah.  I am not sure if that is a good sign for him or not.  Admitting to knowing isn’t a path to victory.  But he also has a blog, so he’s in that club… though I did see him in space in Pasha just the other day haranguing the new players and handing out goodies from the Magic School Bus and I am pretty sure I shook hands with him at one EVE Vegas or another. So how do you figure out whom to vote for?  I suppose reading the statements and listening to their interviews will help, if you know the warning signs. Anybody who says they are going to make something happen or will make CCP listen or anything like that is generally worth passing on.  That isn’t the way the CSM works.  It is fine to advocate for a certain line of thought, but you don’t get to make anything happen.  This is a job that requires data and persuasion.  CCP is free to, and often does, ignore the CSM. I am also down on anybody who represents one play style who is looking to wreck another play style.  That isn’t always obvious unless you know the code phrases.  A favorite of late is somebody from low sec going on about force projection which, when explored, generally translates into “I want to kill null sec.”  But I might be more sensitive to that than most given where I live. Anyway, the campaigns are under way. My early prediction is that incumbents will be returned to office, as always… so that is seven seats covered.  Then Goonswarm will get two candidates elected which, while there is no official ballot yet, will likely mean Kazanir (an incumbent, so already covered) and Zintage.  And the other two likely winners are Ariel Rin if The Initiative gets behind them on the first ballot and Kenneth Feld if PanFam and Winter Coalition set their ballots correctly. If that plays out, the only question will be who CCP will pick from those in 11th to 20th place. Related: CCP – CSM19 Dev Blog CCP – CSM 19 Candidate Announcements CCP – CSM Candidate Campaign Forum CCP – The Roles and Duties of a member of the Council of Stellar Management
html:
The application period to run for the 19th EVE Online Council of Stellar Management closed a week back and on Friday CCP announced the candidates who would be on the ballot for the election.

Council of Stellar Management 19

The campaign period is now in full swing, with CCP having done quick interviews on Twitch with candidates.  The campaign period will run until voting commences on October 17th.

  • 4-14 October: CSM 19 Campaign Period
  • 17-24 October: CSM 19 Voting Period

I don’t know what CCP thinks candidates are supposed to do on the 15th and 16th… I mean, I just copied and pasted their dates… but I suspect it will be more campaigning.

This time around there are 49 candidates running for the 10 seats on the council… with those who place between 11th and 20th in the ballots being possible picks for the remaining two seats that CCP chooses to balance out the group.

49 just happens to be the same number of candidates who were in for the CSM18 election.  So… continuity I guess.

I have taken CCP’s post about the candidates and put it in a table and added the link to the candidate’s forum post describing their plan for the CSM.  I have also marked incumbents with a single asterisk and those who have served on the CSM before with a double asterisk.

Candidate Alliance Corp
Aerodinamica Attiva None Reckless and Uncontrolable Feeding
Alcoholic Satan* Pandemic Horde A Blessed Bean
Ankh Lai Goonswarm Federation Strategically Bad
Aqustin Agustus Brave Collective Spoopy Newbies
Ariel Rin The Initiative. Tactically Challenged
AtheistOfFail None Totality Squad
Aurous Victoirespere Space Madness. Phantom Space
Bexey Songweaver Aurora Alliance Phantom Regiment
Colby Bosh’tet Feasting Frenzy Great White Hunters
commander Shepard Brotherhood Goonswarm Federation Mindstar Technology
creatnos NullSechnaya Sholupen You’re dunked
Dalros Absolute Will Absolute Order VI
Drake Iddon Rote Kapelle CastleKickers
Dujek Oneye Brave Collective Brave Newbies Inc.
DutchGunner Wicked Angels. Circle of Abyss
Frippyy Goonswarm Federation KarmaFleet
Frozen Fallout Federation Front Line Federation Front Line Report
Gideon Zendikar D-sync. D-sync
Grima The Mad Recursive Horizons Ouroboros Solutions
Gustav Mannfred Remember Mumuit Summer of Mumuit
Hexator Gaming No Therapy Loot ‘n’ Scoot Salvage Co.
Itaer IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII Neurotoxin Control
Kazanir* Goonswarm Federation GoonWaffe
Kenneth Feld** Pandemic Legion Habitual Euthanasia
Komo Sunder The Initiative. Applied Anarchy
Kshal Aideron* The Ancients. F.U.N. Inc.
Luke Anninan* Fraternity. Into Oblivion.
Machagon None Amamake Anarchist Community College
Mcopiate Brave Collective Asylum Misfits
Mick Fightmaster No Vacancies. No Vacancies
Mike Azariah* None The Scope
MILINT ARC Trooper None Pator Tech School
NeoShocker Scary Wormhole People The Dark Space Initiative
Phantomite** Watch This Blue Canary
Prospektor Schipplock EDENCOM DEFENSIVE INITIATIVE EDENCOM Section 7
Redus Taw Pandemic Horde Farmers Union Iced Coffee
Rots Mijnwerker Out of the Blue. Into the Ether
Seddow Deepwater Hooligans Outback Steakhouse of Pancakes
SeriesPro UNITED SOUTH Don’t Be a Menace to South Central
SKALE Organa TURBOFEED OR GLORY Holey Roamin’ Empire
steven mardis Sugar. Wormhole Effects
Storm Delay* Pandemic Horde Horde Vanguard.
Styxx D.A.R.K. Dark Shado
Switch 4 Divine Damnation Heretic Army
The Oz* None Pecunia Infinita
Viciate Minmatar Fleet Alliance Rattini Tribe
Yondu Quill Brave Collective Brave Newbies Inc.
youngpuke2 Sedition. Jerkasaurus Wrecks Inc.
Zintage Enaka Goonswarm Federation Echelon Research

49 candidates is a lot of people and, more than 18 years into the game, I could probably string together three sentences about maybe five of them… and at least two of those would need to go negative.

On the flip side, I can only confirm one candidate knows who I am… or at least pretends to… which is Mike Azariah.  I am not sure if that is a good sign for him or not.  Admitting to knowing isn’t a path to victory.  But he also has a blog, so he’s in that club… though I did see him in space in Pasha just the other day haranguing the new players and handing out goodies from the Magic School Bus and I am pretty sure I shook hands with him at one EVE Vegas or another.

So how do you figure out whom to vote for?  I suppose reading the statements and listening to their interviews will help, if you know the warning signs.

Anybody who says they are going to make something happen or will make CCP listen or anything like that is generally worth passing on.  That isn’t the way the CSM works.  It is fine to advocate for a certain line of thought, but you don’t get to make anything happen.  This is a job that requires data and persuasion.  CCP is free to, and often does, ignore the CSM.

I am also down on anybody who represents one play style who is looking to wreck another play style.  That isn’t always obvious unless you know the code phrases.  A favorite of late is somebody from low sec going on about force projection which, when explored, generally translates into “I want to kill null sec.”  But I might be more sensitive to that than most given where I live.

Anyway, the campaigns are under way.

My early prediction is that incumbents will be returned to office, as always… so that is seven seats covered.  Then Goonswarm will get two candidates elected which, while there is no official ballot yet, will likely mean Kazanir (an incumbent, so already covered) and Zintage.  And the other two likely winners are Ariel Rin if The Initiative gets behind them on the first ballot and Kenneth Feld if PanFam and Winter Coalition set their ballots correctly.

If that plays out, the only question will be who CCP will pick from those in 11th to 20th place.

Related:

  • CCP – CSM19 Dev Blog
  • CCP – CSM 19 Candidate Announcements
  • CCP – CSM Candidate Campaign Forum
  • CCP – The Roles and Duties of a member of the Council of Stellar Management
